info.document:
With around 739,000 followers, a high-end sneaker collection that's got the whole world raving and A-listers for friends, Rashed Belhasa is a social media icon to reckon with. At 15, he has a clothing line, a thriving YouTube channel called MoneyKicks, and business acumen of an adult that teaches him how to stay thick-skinned while dealing with hate.

You may know him as the 'rich kid', or the 'famous teen', but there is a lot more to Rashed. The teenager was at LeBHVMarais store in CityWalk Dubai, to showcase his newly launched sprayground bags. Fans thronged the store to meet and greet the teen celebrity.

Here are 5 lesser-known things about the teen star:

1) His first love is social media, but football comes a close second!

He played football at a sports club in Dubai for six to seven years. "Every day, I'd come back from school and go for training. I never had weekends, because I'd usually have a match over the weekend," Rashed said. One can only imagine his excitement upon meeting ace football players Wayne Rooney and Lionel Messi!

2) Nobody can beat him in table tennis

The 15-year-old went on to claim that he also enjoys playing table tennis, and challenged that nobody can beat him at it.

3) You know his flashy Ferrari that the whole world can't stop talking about? He wasn't sure about it!

'Listen to yourself and don't be shy', is the teenager's mantra for success. "When I got the Ferrari car, I was like 'No, no', but I knew in my head that it would become a big hit, and now it has reached 3 million views, and was covered by all the media. "I know how to make big videos," he laughed.

4) Being Rashed Belhasa isn't easy.

Rashed has quite an erratic schedule. His day ends at 3:00am, and he wakes up at 10:30am. He quickly showers and heads to the office, and then to the store to check the sale of his bags. After braving a long but rewarding day, he hangs out with his friends.

5) He doesn't care about the haters

"If you don't get hate, you're not successful. When you have haters, you know you're doing something right," he explained how he deals with any negativity.-

For more LoopArabia goodies, check out Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
